abstract: Texas Instruments forecasts lower fourth-quarter sales than some analysts estimated, indicating that demand for electronic components remain sluggish; says revenue will be $3.26 billion to $3.54 billion in the period; company's stock declines 30 cents, to $31.39 on news; third-quarter profit fell to $601 million, or 51 cents a share, from $859 million, or 71 cents a share; revenue decline 7.3 percent to $3.47 billion.
snippet: The maker of analog semiconductors predicted revenue would miss analysts’ expectations because of falling demand.
lead_paragraph: The maker of analog semiconductors predicted revenue would miss analysts’ expectations because of falling demand.

headline.seo: Texas Instruments Expects Lower Sales in Fourth Quarter
